text.0: o brahmaṆaspati stand up godserving men we pray to thee.
text.1: may they who give good gifts the maruts come to us indra most swift be thou with them.
text.2: o son of strength each mortal calls to thee for aid when spoil of battle waits for him.
text.3: o maruts may this man who loves you well obtain wealth of good steeds and hero might.
text.4: may brahmaṇaspati draw nigh may sūnṛtā the goddess come.
text.5: and gods bring to this rite which gives the fivefold gift the hero lover of mankind.
text.6: he who bestows a noble guerdon on the priest wins fame that never shall decay.
text.7: for him we offer sacred herogiving food peerless and conquering easily.
text.8: now brahmaṇaspati speaks forth aloud the solemn hymn of praise.
text.9: wherein indra and varuṇa mitra aryaman the gods have made their dwelling place.
text.10: may we in holy synods gods recite that hymn peerless that brings felicity.
text.11: if you o heroes graciously accept this word may it obtain all bliss from you.
text.12: who shall approach the pious who the man whose sacred grass is trimmed.
text.13: the offerer with his folk advances more and more he fills his house with precious things.
text.14: he amplifies his lordly might with kings he slays een mid alarms he dwells secure.
text.15: in great or lesser fight none checks him none subduesthe wielder of the thunderbolt.
